website_summaries.verdict: Design allows you to release the coals easily through a one-touch valve.
pros: Vented lower chamber will cause the charcoal to light more quickly than other designs
Also contains an upper chamber, so you can distribute the hot coals more effectively once they're lit
You can release the coals in the upper chamber with a one-touch release valve
cons: Barrier between chambers may not hold in place over time, causing problems

customer_reviews.title: love love love this. I woudln't bbq without it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of chimneys over the years and loved all of them. This is an absolute improvement over previous designs i've had. It was a little tricky getting the bottom plate in place (it doesn't come installed) but once that was done it's brain-dead simple to operate. Load your charcoal, throw some paper in the bottom (add oil to the paper if you want, helps it catch) and wait a couple minutes. Your coals will be ROCKET hot. Hold over the grill and pull the release handle and the coals drop in place. VERY easy. Add more coals on top if needed. The super large capacity of this model means you can get rolling faster.
customer_reviews.author: Led Jedi

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept of not having to turn the chimney ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this the handle fell off because the screws used on it were too short. I love the concept of not having to turn the chimney upside down, but the manufacturer had to know the screws were too short when they were installed. I can't get the screws that came in it out, to replace them with longer screws.
customer_reviews.author: shirleyt

customer_reviews.title: Made from cheap Chinesium metal - not stainless or galvanized
customer_reviews.text: The body became very discolored the first time I used it. Rusted out after less than a full season. The spring mechanism no longer works due to rust build up. Absolute garbage. Included a photo of a 3 year old Weber for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Ralphie

customer_reviews.title: Safest way to light charcoal or chips
customer_reviews.text: We use this to start a charcoal grill without messy and horrible tasting chemicals. Just put some paper under the bottom and light it up. Once the fire comes from the top, squeeze the handle to release the coals. This is the third one we have had. It is the safest by far. Rather than pouring them out, this just releases it from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Momma B

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but after each use the bottom falls out and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but after each use the bottom falls out and has to be reinserted. Not as advertised and not what I had in mind. I was better off with my old one that I had to turn upside down to release the coals.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Glick,Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: I Hate To Criticize But This Thing Is Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I have a Char-Griller Duo and I love it, so I bought this chimney to go with it. Well, after maybe a dozen uses, the bottom flap fell out of the thing, and even though I could place it back together, it just kept falling out after every two or three uses. It is very flimsy and borders on 'cheap'. And I hate to say that because I like the Char-Griller company. So...I went to Lowes and picked up a Webber brand chimney. It's designed differently, with a permanent bottom and no flap that could bend and fall out. I used the Webber last night and it worked great. (Yes I grill every chance I get) Anyways...beware of the flap!
customer_reviews.author: R L Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought one sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't get one of these sooner! I recently got back into charcoal grills/smokers and didnt want the hassle of using lighter fluid. I watched some YouTube videos and decided I liked the coal release door on the bottom. The release door works great for getting the coal into my offset smoker box. My coals light very easily using the little Weber fuel blocks...only need one to light the coal. 20 mins later the coal is ready to cook on. I absolutely love this thing. Some reviewers said they have problems with the release door...but i havent had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: rj4wd

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: I chose this chimney to replace my old, trusty one.(not this model) I was very disappointed in the quality of this chimney. The concept is good, however, as soon as you put charcoal in the chimney itself, the flap serves no purpose at all. The purpose of a chimney is to keep the flame close underneath charcoal and not let the charcoal actually touch the flame, enabling the coal to light up seperately. I grill every day in the summer, and, I found this chimney to be an absolute waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: David DeVan

customer_reviews.title: I really like how the hottest coals end up at the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like how the hottest coals end up at the bottom of the grill instead of the top of the stack closest to the grill. Much better heat distribution. I can't believe no one has designed a chimney with a bottom that opens like this before!
customer_reviews.author: Travis J. Tindal, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Charcoal Starter
customer_reviews.text: Bought a cheap charcoal started at Wal-mart which lasted a good while but wanted a quick release starter to make it easier. Bought a few started at Home Depot which fell apart and found this one and had good reviews. The first and second time it worked well but the third time the part that holds the charcoal fell apart, no worries....easy fix. However, every single time that I've used it, that same part falls apart and I have to fix it. Too much hassle for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the handle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Kamodo Jr-it’s a little large and doesn’t fit in completely. Since I used Lump charcoal there was quite a bit of sparking so I quickly closed the lid so I wouldn’t burn my house down -I stepped away for a a quick moment and then when I returned I found the black plastic handle completely melted! I was able to salvage it by wrapping the remainder in heat resistant furnace tape so I can still use it but just wanted to leave a word of caution.
customer_reviews.author: Riko

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 2nd use; seller wouldn’t replace outside of 30 day window
customer_reviews.text: The idea behind this is great, but unfortunately the product is not well made. The handle broke the second time I used it. The seller would not replace it since it was outside of the 30 day return window. They had no interest in more info or confirmation that the product had hardly been used. As noted by another user, the trap door falls out of place after each use as well. Looking for a replacement for this quality-free product.
customer_reviews.author: Pixee

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great
customer_reviews.text: This is a major improvement over my last one. It is wider, so you can put the same amount of charcoal in it and have it get going much faster. With my old one I had to wait like 15 minutes for the coals to fire up, and the top ones never got there, but with this one they are ready to go very quickly, 5 minutes or so and you're cooking! The mechanism is decent, but very simple. Overall I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: ++GREAT replacement for my coffee can!++
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and a must have bbq charcoal. Easy to start up you BBQer with this tool. Easy to use just a little paper,and your coals will be ready to cook on. I was worried about it being a little thin but nope worked great. Great price,and only time will tell. Most definitely better then my old coffee can,and vise grips.
customer_reviews.author: NVmike

customer_reviews.title: Rusted and literally fell apart in 3 months use.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rusted out even though it was never wet, the floor plate warped and popped out and the handles fell off when I set it down after using it. There is NO warranty for this product. I highly advise you to steer clear. Over priced chineesium piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: A.Smith

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Just Works
customer_reviews.text: Best chimney charcoal starter. It is well built but simple in design. Yes you have to reset the floor manually so what ! I don't understand why someone hasn't come up with this sooner. Pouring lit charcoal out of the old design is so risky and requires you wear a glove to prevent getting singed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Graves

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about the protective coatings on the trigger mechanism, but it appears to be a silicone, which should last. Gets mushy when hot, which give me the silicon impression. Overall, very happy at the quality, construction and function. Much larger than I thought it was going to be.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander DeLarge

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money, less chance of burning hand
customer_reviews.text: The grill chimney worked great all the times I’ve used it. I have the standard grill chimney that got too hot , sometimes to the point that I had to wear my welding gloves. The Char-Griller Chimney makes it easier to distribute the coals without burning my hand. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Starting charcoal has never been easier or faster!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with how fast the charcoal was lit and ready to use. The quick release handle allowed the charcoal to drop into place and was evenly dispersed providing a consistent temperature without cold spots. My friend was there to watch and he was surprised at how effective and efficient the chimney works
customer_reviews.author: I Love my Betta

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy this chimney
customer_reviews.text: Nothing heats coals as efficiently and consistently as a chimney. This chimney has a bottom that drops out when you pull the lever, which is WAAAAY better than having to turn the chimney over and dump the coals out. This is an awesome product. Do yourself a favor and buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Drayton Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This is still a good product although the specific one I received seem to have a manufacturing defect. The floor that the charcoal sits on doesn’t always drop when the release pin is pulled. This causes some excessive handling of the item while it is very hot. I would just suggest wearing a heat resistant pair of gloves while using. It’s a good sized chimney I still feel this design works better than having to upturn and dump like other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Clark

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product.  This is built like a tank and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. This is built like a tank and works perfectly. I had never used a charcoal chimney, and a new Akorn Grill, this was much easier to use than my old electric resistance heater starter. Be careful about waiting too long to transfer the charcoal. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NSJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for Larger Grills
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing... the flip down function is a bonus but the best part is it is significantly larger than most others I’ve owned. I have a fairly large grill and I wasn’t able to put enough charcoal in before this one. If you have a larger grill I’d definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to start the grill
customer_reviews.text: I use hardwood charcoal exclusively, and the chimney is the perfect way to start the grill without having to use lighter fluid. Just crumble a couple sheets of newspaper in the bottom, add the lump charcoal and light. The coals are ready to cook with in about 15 minutes. The great part of using the chimney with crumpled paper is not lighter fluid taste in the food.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schindler

customer_reviews.title: Great for a while, but...
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it it worked like a charm. Super convenient and safe way to release the coals on a precise spot without stirring up a storm of sparks and hot ash like conventional chimney starters. After a few uses the swinging bottom plate warped from the heat and came out. I put it back and straightened it so I could keep using it but could no longer rely on the swinging plate to work correctly so just used it like a standard, dump-out chimney.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great charcoal started.
customer_reviews.text: The Char-Griller charcoal starter is better than expected. I use lump style charcoal and have been able to start the BBQ fast and easy without the smell or taste of charcoal starter fluid. The built-in release ensures that I can easily position and dump the charcoal once it is started. Highly recommend for ease, safety, and usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Meador

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hubby
customer_reviews.text: My husband is new to grilling and was having the hardest time keeping the grill hot and making the heat last. Since he has been using this, he has had good results. Its really easy to use and the price wasnt bad. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: MsMe84

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor construction and materials.
customer_reviews.text: It falls apart every time I use it, and is now corroded and rusted. The squeeze handle does not fully release the "gate" to allow the coals to drop at times - it is starting to bind up due to the corrosion. Stay clear and spend extra for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Weber has a better design
customer_reviews.text: Get the Weber brand version. The quality of this one isn’t as good as the one from Weber. The main difference is the bottom tray that the charcoal sits on. You will definitely get a better burn in Weber’s because it has better air flow underneath the charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Silk

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all serious grillers.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kamado grill dumping coals from a regular chimney is dangerous. You have to be very careful that the coals don’t fall out while you are tipping it over. This chimney takes all that away. Great product. I’m a little worried about how long it will last. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Just chilling

customer_reviews.title: Product is not safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in preparation for a large summer BBQ. I thought the idea of just dropping the hot coals from the bottom would be really cool and safe. Boy was I wrong. The bottom that holds the charcoal broke off one of the chutes. How lucky was I that it broke while loading the coals. Imagine if the bottom broke while transferring the hot coals to the smoker and the fell on my feet and legs. This product is not safe. This happened and n one days use.
customer_reviews.author: f95ozdawg7

customer_reviews.title: Another BEST item
customer_reviews.text: Tim the Tool Man would love this - finally the right amount of charcoal to get a good bed of coals. I scoop the coals from the last fire into this and new coal on top. Works great. Love the drop out bottom.
customer_reviews.author: rick scheiderer

customer_reviews.title: Char-Griller Charcoal Chimney Starter w/ Bottom-Release Mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Char-Griller Charcoal Chimney Starter with Bottom-Release will be my mainstay method of lighting my charcoal grill smoker from now on. Simple fill, easy lighting from within or underneath, quick bottom-release action once the coals are lit and burning, precludes the need for lifting and dumping coals into the smoker grill. Good value for the price. 5 stars for prompt shipment, item as described functional-wise, and larger than expected.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. G.

customer_reviews.title: Solid & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that you can release the charcoal briquettes without having to turn the entire chimney upside down. I can use it on a large barbecue or or my little smoky Joe. the bottom exit is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Fall Out Fix
customer_reviews.text: I love this chimney with the drop bottom. I do not love how after a few uses, the tabs bend from the heat, and the bottom falls completely out when released. I had one for a whole year before I got fed up bending the tabs every other use and putting the bottom back in basically every time I released it. So I ordered a new one, and had the idea of putting a rebar tie between the tabs. That way it eliminates the bottom coming completely out when the tabs bend and slip out of the holes. It's not pretty, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bottom falls out every time we use it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chimney because you just pull the handle to release the coals instead of turning it upside down. Great idea but the bottom that is supposed to release and come back just falls out. Then you have to retrieve it from the hot coals, find a place for it to cool and replace it into the chimney. I have had this for about a month. I think it worked well the first two times. After that, there has been an issue almost every time.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Carmody

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fast lighting
customer_reviews.text: Shocked how fast it lights charcoal. Easy to use, protection from heat for hands. Easy dumping of charcoal, only knock: tricky loading newspapers for lighting. Haven’t found great way yet
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Present for my husband
customer_reviews.text: Y’all, this thing is HUGE. Bigger than what I’m used to seeing, so I was shocked when I pulled it out. Trust me when I say it’s more than big enough to get your fire going and keeps those embers burning.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good value
customer_reviews.text: We've used it several times for bbq parties and it seems to work fine. As others have said, it has a larger in diameter than expected, which is both good and bad... it allows for more coal to be heated at once, but also becomes a little unwieldy. We haven't had spring issues like others have mentioned, but did notice that the heat treatment/protection could be better
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy flapper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he ended up replacing it a couple months later because the flapper that releases the charcoal was super flimsy and kept falling open. Would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and safe.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I knew about this type of charcoal chimney earlier. So easy and safer to have it release the hot coals from the bottom than having to pour them out of the top. Get this if like me, you are on a wood deck!
customer_reviews.author: BBlue

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK SHEET METAL
customer_reviews.text: I TOOK A CHANCE ON THIS CHIMNEY CHARCOAL STARTER BECAUSE THE CONCEPT OF RELEASING THE COALS OUT THE BOTTOM WAS BETTER THAN THE POURING MODEL. SHOULD HAVE KNOWN THAT THE PRICE WAS THE ONLY GOOD THING ABOUT THIS PRODUCT. POORLY MADE OUT OF CHEAP THIN SHEET METAL. PAYING WHAT I DID, I DON'T FEEL SO BAD THROWING IT OUT AFTER 1 USE.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great concept | Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this seven months ago and it worked great at lighting the charcoal. I have a grill by the same manufacturer and its pretty good, but this time it wasn’t a happy story. Third time I used it the release gate got stuck and never worked as supposed to. A month into it, corrosión started to show up. Now it’s fully corroded. (See photos). Wanted to give this five stars but that quickly changed.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pichardo

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Ok with the rust as it does get heated and the whole oxidation thing. However is too flimsy and the “Gate” that holds the coal keeps coming off. Just waiting for it to happen when I have a load of 1,200+ degree Briquettes that fall on my leg or burn a hole in my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: buy a cheap one it'll last longer than this one
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of uses the bottom started falling out by itself without even pulling the handle. I have now lost two different batches of lump charcoal and had to Resort back to a very cheap one that far surpassed the quality and usabality of this one. Don't buy this you will be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lukes

customer_reviews.title: SOMEONE IN R&D SCREWED UP
customer_reviews.text: THE SET SCREWS ON THE HANDLE, NEED TO BE JUST A BIT LONGER - AS THE HANDLE CAME OFF ON THE 1ST TIME, THAT I USED THIS ITEM.......... PROBABLY WON'T HEAR ANYTHING - BUT THEY NEED TO USE LONGER SET SCREWS - VERY SURPRISED THAT THIS FINE COMPANY DID NOT FIGURE THIS OUT --- THANK YOU ! BEEN COOKING FOR ABOUT 50+ YRS, ON SMOKERS AND GRILLS - AND HAVE BEEN USING CHIMNEYS FOREVER -. MIKE JENNINGS DAPHNE, AL
customer_reviews.author: jennings

customer_reviews.title: Although I thought it was a brilliant idea to have the release lever and easily drop ...
customer_reviews.text: Although I thought it was a brilliant idea to have the release lever and easily drop the hot coals into the preferred vessel, it is not the case. Great company with a great idea but I would go with a different model. More often than not the trap door drops before the coals are ready and you're left with a hot mess of wasted charcoal.
customer_reviews.author: paul parrish

customer_reviews.title: Good buy - would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The release mechanism and plate that drops to release the coals are not the thickest of metals but it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I think of this?!
customer_reviews.text: This is cool! I usually set a few chunks of smoke wood in the grill first, and this makes it simple to get the coals right where I want them.
customer_reviews.author: gnosnhoj

customer_reviews.title: weakens and rusts too fast
customer_reviews.text: maybe 2 years use, they rust within 1 year and 2 years kills it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Relax people. Damn.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! No the door doesn’t ‘reload’ turns out springs don’t like heat. Big deal. Being able to carry and release with one hand is awesome. Yes, it probably is made in China. Guess what else is, everything! Grow up. What is this the 1950s? If you’re upset about things made in China, stop using electronics and driving your car. This is a damn charcoal chimney.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Worthey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: It arrived already broken, the bottom screen isn't attached to the trigger release and as far as I can tell there is no way of putting it back in. So essentially I have a big tube with no bottom on it, can't even put charcoal in it because the bottom isn't attached. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The tray on the bottom that holds the charcoal keeps falling out. I wouldn’t recommend this charcoal chimney. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Madison White

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use charcoal starter
customer_reviews.text: Super bang for the buck. This makes placing lit lump charcoal into my smoker so much nicer. Just a squeeze of the handle and done.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Mmm...Lost it's abilitiies
customer_reviews.text: The bests part of this item is the auto dumping mechanism. The unfortunate thing is that it stopped working consistantly. Real bummer cause when it does work it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Foi Mac

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good design and easy to use however the thin metal did not hold up to our grill temperatures. It rusted extremely fast after 2-3 uses causing the arm to get weak and holding tray to break away
customer_reviews.author: Patrick K White

customer_reviews.title: These things are perfect. This is by far the best one I ...
customer_reviews.text: I use a chimney every time I grill. I can not stand the after taste left by the lighter fluid even if I let it burn for a really long time before I cook. These things are perfect. This is by far the best one I have purchased. The handle on the side allowing you to open the bottom is perfect. This allows you to put the coals exactly how you want them. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: If you cook with charcoal, you need a starter, and this one works great. I love that it dumps out of the bottom too. Not sure what you get if you spend more.
customer_reviews.author: dndobson

customer_reviews.title: Great safe product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product on my wood deck - easy to dump the hot coals in the grill without worrying about some losing some..
customer_reviews.author: Tom T.

customer_reviews.title: good deal fast shipping,
customer_reviews.text: good deal fast shipping, would recommend to others and I will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Terry Z.

customer_reviews.title: Bottom broken...
customer_reviews.text: Bottom was already disconnected from the body of the charcoal chimney! I had to fix it! Wondering how often the bottom will fall out when I don't want it to??? I should have returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: It work's but!!!
customer_reviews.text: The item does what is described. However, the craftsmanship or quality control needs a little work. The handle, plastic part, came off during the usage of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Its ok for the price but I did find one at a grocery store that was thicker and more sturdy and cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy directions to light charcoal. No problem using except once you dump the coal the bottom does not automatically close. Otherwise it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Aleeze

customer_reviews.title: Great Charcoal Grill Chimeny Starter
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately we can find this type of charcoal grill chimney starter online, since they are no longer available in stores. We like this style (charcoal drops from the bottom) much better than the type you must dump the charcoal from the top. We will continue to buy this style once this one finally wears out after many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S

customer_reviews.title: works great, starts fast with coals on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Another invention that was rolling around my head that was on Amazon, works great, starts fast with coals on the bottom, used with real hardwood charcoal in a Big Green Egg. Takes half the time than a regular charcoal chimney because the hot coals are on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy drop
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don’t have to turn over the Chimney to drop the coals in. I have only used a handful of times so not sure if the sturdiness. But we will see how the bottom holds up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and solid
customer_reviews.text: Heats charcoal so quick totally worth the $$. It’s very solid and easy to release.
customer_reviews.author: S. Remtula

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Very good concept and the best working of these types of charcoal chimneys that I've tried. But it only lasted one season, it's already sitting in pieces on my back deck because it fell apart the last time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Solid item that works as advertised! Quality I expect from Char Griller! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how fast or well these things work. Truly amazing. Never have to mess with lighter fluid again.
customer_reviews.author: Blatchford Sarnemington

customer_reviews.title: Bent upon opening.
customer_reviews.text: Well, even though it was in bubble wrap it was bent at the bottom. Not very pleased. I have to bend it back in order for the release to work.
customer_reviews.author: Enrico Aiello

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no stars for this product. Bought in May and completely fell apart before 4th of July. Don’t waste your money like we did. I only gave it a one star because it made me.
customer_reviews.author: Martha DeMent

customer_reviews.title: A solid investment.
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best investment for anyone who barbecues regularly. I still can't believe how hot my coals get without the use of gas!
customer_reviews.author: Rudy A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you only barbeque on holidays, not built for us that barbeque year round. Will not last.
customer_reviews.text: The very thin bottom plate was bent after 10-12 uses. Cheap crap! Buy a weber instead!
customer_reviews.author: Dale G Dalman

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. Hubby is very happy with this. Great size. Very sturdy, looks like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: linda tucker

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This is much bigger than I thought it would be. The mechanism that holds coals in place , fell out within 3 uses and I had to Jerry rig it back in place. It works ok now.
customer_reviews.author: Mautz’y 18

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome works perfect, so much easier since it has a trap door
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this.
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a chimney starter and I love the fact that you can press the release button when the charcoal is ready to go into the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Mason

customer_reviews.title: Bad Boy!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're a griller. this is it for starting your grill. This is 1 bad chimney!!! WOW!!! Starts great, holds a massive amount of charcoal!!! If you can't get your grill going with this, go back to gas.
customer_reviews.author: JIM HORRELL

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It works but the piece on the inside keeps falling out. Pretty much useless. I haven’t had it long
customer_reviews.author: Teresa E. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Very Flimsy compared to fixed bottom
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy after the first use. I would stick to the non quick release version. After only 2 months of use, it is in worst shape than my original fixed bottom chimney.
customer_reviews.author: DRouse

customer_reviews.title: good Chatcoal started, but.....
customer_reviews.text: Bottom fell out of the charcoal starter after a few months of use. The bottom bowed due to heat over time making it easy to fall out. Fix was simple, Straighten the bottom, reinsert into the body of the starter and bend upwards the flanges that hold the bottom to the body of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: David A Witt

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: He loves it! It’s so convenient for him starting his grill up. He is a grill master, so he loves when new grill items come to the market!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawnta McClinton

customer_reviews.title: This charcoal grill heats charcoals fast and easy dumping of the charcoal with the squeeze release flap
customer_reviews.text: This charcoal grill heats charcoals fast and easy dumping of the charcoal with the squeeze release flap . A minor inconvenience is the flap becomes detached from time to time ..
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Big, but not big enough.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. It's big but not large enough to hold enough charcoal for a full sized grill.
customer_reviews.author: Qeren hap-puwk Yisra'el

customer_reviews.title: But we just glued it on and its been fine since. Now the latch where the coals sits ...
customer_reviews.text: This is okay. When I got it out of the box the black part of the handle came off. Where it screws into the metal the black plastic piece broke. But we just glued it on and its been fine since. Now the latch where the coals sits sticks and then wont let the bottom close and when your dealing with hot items its the last thing you need to be dealing with. It does hold a lot of coals tho
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great for the value and easy to use don't have to pour the embers out just squeeze handle
customer_reviews.text: It worked real good I would recommended if you BBQ invest in one, I used newspaper to light it but will use firestarter instead of having ash from the newspaper flying around.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice lighter. They all wear out from the heat. This is good quality and works well
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: This chimney is nice and large and we especially like dropping the charcoal ...
customer_reviews.text: This chimney is nice and large and we especially like dropping the charcoal right into the grill instead of dumping it out and running the chance of burning yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Sneu

customer_reviews.title: Work's great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, just set it on the side burner. No lighter fluid
customer_reviews.author: todd chapin

customer_reviews.title: Great value overall.
customer_reviews.text: Helps so much plus the quick release is so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Sage

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I like the charcoal chimney because I don't need the nasty lighter fluid. It starts the charcoal just as fast. Worthwhile for me.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Ruppenthal

customer_reviews.title: Gets you cookin fast!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It gets your charcoal to cooking quickly. It’s much quicker and easier than old dad’s way of stacking the coals, covering it with lighter fluid and waiting for it “get hot”.
customer_reviews.author: jason hildreth

customer_reviews.title: Very just OK.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, it's pretty big. The door that drops is very cheap and the hinge design is even cheaper. I would not buy it again, but it works for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: So convenient. My boyfriend loves it. Definitely worth more than five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J James

customer_reviews.title: Works for lighting charcoal, but flap release can be sticky and annoying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chimney for my Char Griller Akorn grill. It does light the charcoal easily. The problem comes from the release at the bottom. It seems really sticky. Also, the tabs that sit in the holes and hold it in place on the opposite side from the handle don't hold the tabs well - they can slide out, dropping your charcoal prematurely if they aren't sitting just right. I eventually bent the tabs down with a pliers so they would stay in place. A couple of times, the release wouldn't let the flap go, and I ended up having to dump the red-hot charcoal out of the top.
customer_reviews.author: Kriszena

customer_reviews.title: Great chimney starter
customer_reviews.text: I've had my eye on one of these for awesome and finally got one. Love this thing. It hold a lot of charcoal and is very easy to use. The release handle is very accessable and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Webb

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just as I hoped the tool would in quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this. so glad i got it. safer because it has drop latch.
customer_reviews.author: pamwil

product_meta.title: Char-Griller Charcoal Grill Chimney Starter with Quick Release Trigger, 12-Inch
product_meta.description: Style:OriginalChar-Griller charcoal chimney starter with quick-release makes starting your charcoal grill fast & easy. Fill the E-Z starter with charcoal & light it. Once your coals are hot, squeeze the patented trigger to drop the charcoal into your grill. No more messy pouring of hot coals - just release them right where you want them. The hottest coals even stay on the bottom for better heat distribution & more efficient grilling. The ABS handle with heat shield protects your hands from the heat. Large size: 7. 75" Diameter x 12" Height for fast & efficient starting. The Char-Griller charcoal chimney starter holds plenty of coals for any grill or occasion & is designed for maximum airflow for the fastest charcoal starting.
feature_bullets: E-Z Starter w/Patented Trigger release for easy charcoal placement.
Quick release drops hot coals onto your fire grate with no messy pouring
Built in release keeps the hottest coals on the bottom for better heat distribution and a more efficient grilling
Large size makes starting your charcoal grill fast and easy
ABS handle w/heat shield for handling safety

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars663 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
